Word of the Day

February 20, 2024

Ọba

/ɔ.ba/
noun

King, monarch, or sovereign ruler

In Yoruba culture, the Ọba is more than just a king - they are seen as a divine representative and custodian of cultural heritage.

"Ọba tuntun jẹ ọba tó dára."

The new king is a good king.

Language Insights

Did You Know?

Discover fascinating facts about the Yoruba language and its unique characteristics.

Tonal Language

The Yoruba language is tonal, with three tones: high (´), mid (unmarked), and low (`). These tones can change the meaning of words completely.

Example: igba

  • ìgbàtime
  • igbácalabash
  • ìgbágarden egg

Rich Proverbs

Yoruba is known for its rich collection of proverbs (òwe), which are considered 'the horses of speech' - when words are lost, proverbs are used to find them.

Yoruba Proverb

"Òwe lẹṣin ọ̀rọ̀, bí ọ̀rọ̀ bá sonù, òwe la fi ńwá a."

Translation

Proverbs are the horses of speech, when speech is lost, we use proverbs to find it.

Numerical System

The Yoruba numerical system is vigesimal (base-20) rather than decimal (base-10), reflecting the traditional counting method using fingers and toes.

Numerical System

ogúntwenty (20)

Basic unit in the vigesimal system
